intro: Cyphostemma cryptoglandulosum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, waxy, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. Its stems are woody and can grow quite long, allowing it to climb along trees or shrubs. Cyphostemma cryptoglandulosum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
